column4: Well part of the issue is that they changed some of the underlying stuff (like X.Org to 1.3) and the hardware manufacturers haven't released their drivers yet. Plus, if your hardware is a few years old, they're not supoorting it. ATI is one that comes to mind for me (as I'm using a hacked version of their drivers right now).
Would the so called "hacked drivers" support the X1200?
here's the link to the information. Like I said, it's geared to the HD series, but it might work for you too. http://www.unixmen.com/ubuntu-12-10-and-amd-catalyst-problem-solved/
OK. I'll look into it. Thank you.
